inventory.commentary: Added commentary, modified and added examples, modified definitions. ahouston

sense.name: edifice
sense.commentary: a structure that has a roof and walls and stands more less permanently in one place
sense.examples: There was a three-story building on the corner. Those are luxury apartment buildings. You can park in the lower level of that building complex.

sense.name: occupants
sense.examples: The entire building complained about the noise. My building meets in the common room for a weekly game of scrabble.

sense.name: act of constructing
sense.commentary: BUILDING[+event] the activity of constructing or building something
sense.examples: The building of the skyscraper took three months. During the building we had to take a detour. His hobby was boat building. The architect did not comply with certain building codes. Protein is a major building block of our bodies. You'll need a building permit to put up a greenhouse in your backyard. The building materials we'll need for our patio include sand, bricks, and wood.

sense.name: an enterprise or business engaged in construction
sense.examples: Building and steel have both lost workers in the last several years. (the industry as a whole) They now run a major building firm in Ohio. Workers in the building trades have rough hands.
